intro: Aerides fieldingii var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, showy white flowers with a distinctive green throat, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
